sources.name: Broadberry et al. and Bank of England
sources.description:
Data published by Our World In Data combined the data published by Broadberry et al. and Bank of England
Link The two datasets are available online.
Bank of England data: http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/research/Pages/onebank/threecenturies.aspx
Broadberry's website: https://www.nuffield.ox.ac.uk/People/sites/stephen.broadberry/SitePages/Biography.aspx
Sources retrieved and series calculated 2017-April-02

We have combined real GDP and population data published in Broadberry et al and Bank of England:
1270 to 1700 – Based on absolute value from BoE for 1700 and then backwards using the indexed time-series (indexed to 1700) from Broadberry et al
1700 to 2015 – Bank of England Real GDP per capita is the ratio of the two series.

Broadberry Stephen, Bruce Campbell, Alexander Klein, Mark Overton and Bas van Leeuwen – "British Economic Growth, 1270-1870: An Output-based Approach"

The BoE combines several data sets from 1700 onwards: Broadberry et al (2015); Estimates based on Mitchell (1988); Solomou and Weale (1991); Sefton and Weale (1995); and for the recent period data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS). All details are in Bank of England – Three centuries of macroeconomic data.
